thread.title: Amazon’s Performance Isn’t an Open Book
thread.title_full: Amazon’s Performance Isn’t an Open Book

title: Amazon’s Performance Isn’t an Open Book
text:
Ahead of the Tape Amazon’s Performance Isn’t an Open Book Amazon.com may be a prime example of overpaying for growth given how little information it gives investors about its earnings power By July 22, 2015 1:33 p.m. ET 
It seemed like old times for Amazon.com Inc. after it reported quarterly results in April. 
The stock surged decisively above $400 a share. It now hovers near record highs just below $500 ahead of its second-quarter report Thursday. 
For anyone who has followed Amazon very long, the $400 mark resonates because that is the target price a... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
